description: They weren't lying when they said no GUI. Open it up, drop a file into the window, and you're viewing with nothing else to tweak. Works well in my limited testing.
summary: Displays my STEP models nicely, simple to use

description: An option to save settings would be great, and FBX support with this version?
Very fast for previewing different types of files

Looks 10/10 and it's simple and offers exactly what I wanted. I only wish it could rotate the objects slightly better. Like mirror them or offer some kind of XYZ manipulation, like in CADs (would be really cool!)

Too bad something's messed up on Fedora, because this app and some other apps appear on the non-primary screen.

I also wish there was an RPM on their GitHub. Could have made a release with RPMs, but I don't know if it's difficult or not...
I use it to view stl file. It's very fast and can easily rotate the part.

This app is exactly as marketed. It pops up instantly after opening a file without any startup loading whatnots. The object is already there for instant viewing. I'm honestly blown away by this bit of software. It's extremely small, Even the most potato of potato computers could run this I'm sure. I will use this piece of software until the day it no longer exists. I honestly can't give this a better review. 
If your looking for a quick option for viewing 3d files, this is the app for you. You can't modify the file in anyway but who needs to modify it if your just looking at it?
summary: This app is fast, free, small, and easy to use

description: I really wish it would preserve the camera position when reloading the file. It completely resets the view. I would also be great if it supported auto reloading when the file changes.
This soft just doing what it doing. If I need to view some 3d model, I can do it now in my Fedora KDE)
Does what it says it does. Thanks!
The Python binding works very well with a simple API to visualize from within Python.
summary: Great little App for quickly visualizing 3D objects

description: Good app but wish it would launch faster
